Government of India seas no objection® t* to. £rt/£^ 7. oii<\ iA OFFICE. POM. . - rtosr fz (^<L ^ ll^H I e,. dr [CYPHER]. PILE COP^ Vith the Compliments iden S cretary of State for F ^ > iiftitm ^ P^s. f,,. © A)L 1 ._,,ow DEPARIMBKTAL N0.1. FRa 'PEIiRAl^ TO FOREIGN OFFICE. Sir R* Bullard, No,972. August'1st 1942. D. 7.40 p.ra. August 1st 1942. R. 10.35 p.m. August 1st 1942, Repeated to Government of India, Copy by bag Meshed, MOST SECREJ. . M.1.6. are anxious to establish a forward W.T. and information station at Zahidan and propose to send there forthwith Mr. S.N. Sedcole with the rank of Vice-Consul and I.fr. I. Toledano wireless operator (to he described as clerk). K. 2, I see no objection and if you and the Government of India see no objection we will proceed accordingly, (INDIV).

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'Ext 4041/42 Establishment of an MI6 W/T station at Zahidan'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 5; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains telegrams between the British Embassy at Tehran and the Foreign Office regarding the establishment of a Wireless Telegraphy (WT) Station at Zahidan [Zahedan, Iran], and plans to send a clerk and a Vice-Consul.
